CatDescriptText: James Hauser, Aliquippa and Earl Frye, steelworker, Homewood were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 23, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you believe the people who vote only for the President every four years make the best citizens?"  Mr. Hauser's answer reads: "Yes, I do.  When most people vote in the other elections, it's because they or others want political jobs.  This is not so when you vote for President.  Then you're voting to place the best man into office"  Mr. Frye's answer reads "I don't think so.  The people should vote for every election because it is a duty of citizenship."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of James Hauser wearing fedora, sunglasses, and dark leather jacket with plush collar, standing in front of block wall, Downtown; Portrait of Earl Frye wearing light colored fedora with dark band and light colored zippered jacket with dark collar, standing in front of flecked wall, Downtown
